definition:
For any sets $a$ and $b$, the [*ordered pair*]{} $(a,b)$ is the set
$\{\{a\}, \{a,b\}\}$.

The characterizing property of an ordered pair is:
$$(a,b) = (c,d) \iff a=b \text{\ \ and\ \ } c=d,$$ and the above
construction of ordered pair, as weird as it seems, is actually the
simplest possible formulation which achieves this property.
